moves.1. e4: I'm not great at chess, so i wont Analise this game too much, i just like the end:)
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 e6 4. d4: don't know what type of defense I'm using:)
moves.4... d5 5. e5 a6 6. Be3 b6: interesting start, many pawns moved by black
moves.9. Bf4 Bd7 10. c3: getting rid of pawns near white king
moves.16. b3 O-O: castle for black, white still to develop
moves.20. f4 Qxg2: white under attack with blacks knight ready to help
moves.21. Rf1 Ng4 22. a4: wanted to stop attack on f1:/
moves.23. Qe2 Qxe2+: wanting a queen switch, and stopping white castle, fairly sensible?
moves.26... Bg2: don't know what black is doing here
moves.27. Rg1 Bf6: odd move, thought he'd protect bg2
moves.28. Rxg2 Bxe5 29. fxe5: tables turned, white now with a two point advantage
moves.34. hxg6: innocent pawn looks like game winner
moves.34... Ra7 35. gxh7+: kh8 probably most sensible move here, with f7 well protected
moves.35... Kh6: ???!!! game looks finished, i used conditional moves from here
moves.39. Qxg7#:
checkmate,

if i were to come to any conclusion about this game it would have to be that even though switching queens may be favourable for black it always depends on the circumstances and may prove fatal for black, 

hope you've enjoyed my first and probably last annotated game, hope to hear any comments from more experienced players,
